content: Defunct Singaporean radio stationThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Lush 99.5FM" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2012)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Lush 99.5FM** was an English-language radio station of the state-owned broadcaster [Mediacorp](/wiki/Mediacorp) in Singapore. It broadcast an [eclectic](/wiki/Free-form_radio) format with a particular focus on [local](/wiki/Music_of_Singapore) and [indie](/wiki/Independent_music) music, [alternative rock](/wiki/Alternative_rock), [urban adult contemporary](/wiki/Urban_adult_contemporary), and [electronic music](/wiki/Electronic_music). ## History The station launched 31 December 2004 at 7:25 am; MediaCorp stated that Lush would focus on "trendsetting" and "[new-age contemporary](/wiki/New-age_music)" music, including [chill-out](/wiki/Chill-out_music) and [nu jazz](/wiki/Nu_jazz). At its launch, the station broadcast from 7:00 a.m. to 2:00 a.m. daily. On 20 January 2005, the station expanded to 24-hour broadcasting. On 20 August 2009, the station relocated from [Caldecott Hill](/wiki/Caldecott_Hill) to studios at [Orchard Central](/wiki/Orchard_Central). On 7 July 2012, the station moved back to Caldecott Hill. Every week, various guest DJs would be invited on The Lush Mix, which aired on Saturdays from 8pm with repeats on weekdays from 9pm. After having been Mediacorp's lowest-rated radio station for several years, Lush was shut down on 1 September 2017. Mediacorp stated that it wanted to concentrate its efforts on its other English-language stations, and that Lush's remit of showcasing local music would be supplanted by the company-wide "Singapore Sounds" initiative. - [List of radio stations in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_radio_stations_in_Singapore) - Lush 99.5FM Live This article about a radio station in Asia is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about media in Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Lush 99.5FM
